name: places/ChIJy_YtWq1ZwokRqdDgFiQS-Ac
adrFormatAddress: 1217 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text:
I called to schedule an appointment with one of the only two nail techs that I feel are good here. When I got there, they gave the person I had an appointment with to another client because she was the only one who knew to do that service. The nail tech I received was rushing, very rough, and dismissive the entire service.

Apart from bad customer service, I haven’t even had my nails done for 24 hours and my GEL manicure has chipped on 5 nails. The products they use are watered-down and not good quality.

$86 down the drain.

originalText.text: Very expensive considering they do not use a base coat for a manicure or the correct non-UV top coat for the up-charge Essie gel couture polish. The quality of the paint job is very amateur considering UES prices

text.text: Very expensive considering they do not use a base coat for a manicure or the correct non-UV top coat for the up-charge Essie gel couture polish. The quality of the paint job is very amateur considering UES prices

originalText.text:
UPDATE 11/26/22
Not coming back again since one of the customers made racist comment towards me when I went there and they (the nail techs) didn’t do anything about it except laugh it off. Lady proceeded to touch me and I felt uncomfortable.

Cost is very reasonable especially when it comes with having to do a new set of acrylics and/or fill ins. They’re were welcoming when setting up for appointments and/or coming in.
You can also charge your phone with their chargers that they provide to you while doing your nails. Inside the salon is very spacious and clean.

originalText.text: AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Terribly run location. After I got a gel manicure here they told me to come back if anything, which I thought was a nice offer. A few days later, I broke a couple nails while unpacking boxes and came in to see if they could fix it. The manager did it and absolutely butchered my nails - I wanted to cry after because I had a big event to get ready for and told her I didn’t have time to do a whole new manicure (+ I had just gotten them done a few days before and didn’t want additional damage). She was so rude to me and tried to humiliate me in front of the guests, ignored me when I spoke to her. Worse yet she CUT my finger open and acted like it was nothing. She was manhandling me in a passive aggressive way. Honestly I don’t understand how she thinks she can treat another person like this. Worst manicure experience I have ever had.  I normally get Russian manicures which are so much better anyway. I will never go back to thaw awful chain nail salons.

originalText.text: I won’t go again… I have had the exact same nail polish brand and color done on me at another shop before, so I know they didn’t do a good job with it. No attention to detail. Lots of painting over line and missing corners so they chipped after just two days. They also asked for payment and tips before they started painting the nails, which I didnt like.
